title: Angelina Jolie and kids take in Spain as she films Marvel's Eternals
text:
Ange and her kids went shopping as she got back to work (Picture: MEGA)

Angelina Jolie and her kids looked to be in great spirits as they landed in Spain as the actress got to work on Marvel’s Eternals.

The star was seen shopping up a storm after arriving on the island of Fuerteventura, visiting local grocery and discount stores with her brood, while juggling that work/life balance.

Seems she’s stocking up for a long stay, as she gets to work on the next instalment in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

Ange, 44, was beaming as she headed out in several white outfits this week, as she took Zahara, 14, and twins Knox and Vivienne, 11 to a discount store to see what’s good in the area.

She was earlier seen in a slinky cami-dress picking up supplies with Vivienne, as they manoeuvred a trolley down aisles.

Ange looked delighted to be in Spain (Picture: The Mega Agency)

The family shielded their eyes as they left the store (Picture: The Mega Agency)

It comes as she wraps promo duties on Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil and gets to work in the role of superhero Thena in the MCU film that follows on from Avengers.

Due for release in November 2020, production is underway in the Dunes of Corralejo, with tents and trailers seen already set up for the massive filming undertaking.

The star has been seen travelling around the world with her brood she shares with ex-husband Brad Pitt as of late.

Her kids have been by her side (Picture: PA Wire)

The former Hollywood it-couple, who went their separate ways in 2016, have six children together, with Angelina revealing that she had relied on her kids for support after admitting to feeling like she ‘lost herself’ during the split.

‘The last few years have not been the easiest. I have had my ups and downs. I haven’t felt very strong,’ she told The Sun.

Speaking about the last few years, Angelina said: ‘We’ve all been a bit in lockdown.

‘We all have our difficult times. I didn’t work, the kids needed me at home… my strength is from my children.’

She continued: ‘Anyone who is a parent knows there is a strength within you that grows when you just have to survive anything to be strong enough for them and you have to pull them through anything.’

Production on The Eternals started in England last month, with Ange seen sporting a blonde wig on set.

The Eternals, a bunch of super-powered near-immortal beings created by a series of genetic experiments on early humans by a bunch of cosmic gods known as the Celestials, stars Angelina as Thena, alongside Richard Madden and Salma Hayek.

‘I’m so excited to be here! I think what it means to be a part of the MCU, what it means to be an Eternal, what it means to be in this family,’ said Angie as she took on the first superhero film of her career.

The Bodyguard star Richard will play Ikaris, Kumail Nanjianias Kingo, Brian Tyree Henry as Phastos and Don Lee as Gilgamesh, the Forgotten One.

Angelina, Salma, Lauren Ridloff and Lia McHugh are the leading ladies of the films as Thena, Ajak, Makkari, Sprite respectively.

Gemma Chan will play Sersi, making her the first actor to play two different characters in the same universe; she also starred as Minn-Erva in Captain Marvel.

The Eternals is due out on 6 November 2020.
